argumentText:
ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | cantnfs.s | |- S = dom ( A CNF B ) |
| 2 |  | cantnfs.a | |- ( ph -> A e. On ) |
| 3 |  | cantnfs.b | |- ( ph -> B e. On ) |
| 4 |  | oemapval.t | |- T = { <. x , y >. | E. z e. B ( ( x ` z ) e. ( y ` z ) /\ A. w e. B ( z e. w -> ( x ` w ) = ( y ` w ) ) ) } |
| 5 |  | #P_oecl | |- ( ( A e. On /\ B e. On ) -> ( A ^o B ) e. On ) |
| 6 | 2, 3, 5 | #P_syl2anc | |- ( ph -> ( A ^o B ) e. On ) |
| 7 |  | #P_eloni | |- ( ( A ^o B ) e. On -> Ord ( A ^o B ) ) |
| 8 |  | #P_ordwe | |- ( Ord ( A ^o B ) -> _E We ( A ^o B ) ) |
| 9 | 6, 7, 8 | #P_3syl | |- ( ph -> _E We ( A ^o B ) ) |
| 10 | 1, 2, 3, 4 | #P_cantnf | |- ( ph -> ( A CNF B ) Isom T , _E ( S , ( A ^o B ) ) ) |
| 11 |  | #P_isowe | |- ( ( A CNF B ) Isom T , _E ( S , ( A ^o B ) ) -> ( T We S <-> _E We ( A ^o B ) ) ) |
| 12 | 10, 11 | #P_syl | |- ( ph -> ( T We S <-> _E We ( A ^o B ) ) ) |
| 13 | 9, 12 | #P_mpbird | |- ( ph -> T We S ) |
| 14 | 6, 7 | #P_syl | |- ( ph -> Ord ( A ^o B ) ) |
| 15 |  | #P_isocnv | |- ( ( A CNF B ) Isom T , _E ( S , ( A ^o B ) ) -> `' ( A CNF B ) Isom _E , T ( ( A ^o B ) , S ) ) |
| 16 | 10, 15 | #P_syl | |- ( ph -> `' ( A CNF B ) Isom _E , T ( ( A ^o B ) , S ) ) |
| 17 |  | #P_ovex | |- ( A CNF B ) e. _V |
| 18 | 17 | #P_dmex | |- dom ( A CNF B ) e. _V |
| 19 | 1, 18 | #P_eqeltri | |- S e. _V |
| 20 |  | #P_exse | |- ( S e. _V -> T Se S ) |
| 21 | 19, 20 | #P_ax-mp | |- T Se S |
| 22 |  | #P_eqid | |- OrdIso ( T , S ) = OrdIso ( T , S ) |
| 23 | 22 | #P_oieu | |- ( ( T We S /\ T Se S ) -> ( ( Ord ( A ^o B ) /\ `' ( A CNF B ) Isom _E , T ( ( A ^o B ) , S ) ) <-> ( ( A ^o B ) = dom OrdIso ( T , S ) /\ `' ( A CNF B ) = OrdIso ( T , S ) ) ) ) |
| 24 | 13, 21, 23 | #P_sylancl | |- ( ph -> ( ( Ord ( A ^o B ) /\ `' ( A CNF B ) Isom _E , T ( ( A ^o B ) , S ) ) <-> ( ( A ^o B ) = dom OrdIso ( T , S ) /\ `' ( A CNF B ) = OrdIso ( T , S ) ) ) ) |
| 25 | 14, 16, 24 | #P_mpbi2and | |- ( ph -> ( ( A ^o B ) = dom OrdIso ( T , S ) /\ `' ( A CNF B ) = OrdIso ( T , S ) ) ) |
| 26 | 25 | #P_simpld | |- ( ph -> ( A ^o B ) = dom OrdIso ( T , S ) ) |
| 27 | 26 | #P_eqcomd | |- ( ph -> dom OrdIso ( T , S ) = ( A ^o B ) ) |
| 28 | 13, 27 | #P_jca | |- ( ph -> ( T We S /\ dom OrdIso ( T , S ) = ( A ^o B ) ) ) |
\
 The lexicographic order on a function space of ordinals gives a well-ordering with order type equal to the ordinal exponential.  This provides an alternative definition of the ordinal exponential. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2015.)  Obsolete version of ~ oemapwe as of 2-Jul-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
